item.title: Japans größte Finanzgruppe stellt „KI-Mitarbeiter“ ein

item.description: mf Tokio – Mit Verspätung springen Japans Finanzgruppen auf den Zug der künstlichen Intelligenz auf. item.title: Beschwerden über Versicherer nehmen zu
item.author: Handelsblatt
item.description: Frankfurt. item.title: Wird der MSCI World 2026 weiterhin als sichere Wahl gelten?

item.description: Berlin. Das Jahr 2025 war für Anleger ein ungewohntes Börsenjahr. Gold – normalerweise eine Anlageklasse zur Absicherung des Depots – legte noch einmal stärker an Wert zu als 2024. item.title: Fidelity Contrafund Legend Danoff to Retire After 10,500% Run
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Will Danoff, the world’s most prolific solo stock-picker who generated world-beating returns during a run of more than three decades atop the Fidelity Contrafund, is set to retire at year-end. “It has been the privilege of a lifetime to manage Contrafund for 35 years and help million...

item.title: BlackRock Cuts Private Credit Executives Hired Before HPS Deal
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- BlackRock Inc. is cutting about 10 people from its private financing solutions group as it continues to integrate its $12 billion acquisition of HPS Investment Partners. At least three people who were on the firm’s private credit team prior to the purchase are among those affected, a...

item.title: ECB Study Finds ‘Pricing Cascades’ Can Cause Inflationary Wave
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- A relatively contained price shock can trigger a massive inflationary episode if it hits a closely connected network of firms, according to research by the European Central Bank. That’s because of the chain reactions rippling through supply lines, where one firm’s output charges are a...

item.title: ECB Must Keep All Options Open on Rates, Kocher Says
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- The European Central Bank needs to keep all options available due to the unstable global backdrop, particularly on trade, according to Governing Council member Martin Kocher. While officials remain “in a good place,” they face “still very high” uncertainty, the Austrian central-bank ...
